front.div:
2005 comes to an end after two successful events for our project into automated city transport -
The annual mobilicity seminar at the Royal College of Art, London attracted
both a full house on the day and great media coverage in the following weeks.
The research carried out from Oct 04 to Oct 05 was presented and this was
followed by a lively discussion about the potential and challenges of
developing the innovative system. The expert audience included transport
professionals, researchers, designers and both the transport & general press.
The AATS 2005 conference in Bologna was another perfect venue to
present mobilicity since it was essentially a global forum for
automated transport. A number of similar systems are being developed
as the great benefits – in terms of cost and efficiency – become clear.
The next big date is in January 2006 for the NAIAS in Detroit. mobilicity has been selected for the
Michelin Challenge Design by their panel of expert judges, including Dr Paul MacCready of
Gossamer Condor fame, and Gordon Murray. The 1:5 scale model is just being completed at the
Vehicle Design Department at the RCA. The model will now be flown to the USA ready for show.
2006 overall will be a twelve month period of R&D and commercial promotion of the mobilicity
project. A number of shows & conferences have been planned to present both technical and
commercial aspects of mobilicity. This program will be developed together with our partners.
